item.title: Installing Ruby and Jekyll on My MacBook
item.description:
What I like most about Hugo over Jekyll is the simple install process that Hugo provides. It’s just an executable package and available in Homebrew. Jekyll, on the other hand, is based on Ruby so it requires a working Ruby environment to work in, and that can be a rail pain in the @$$.

My Intel MacBook, like all Macs, comes with a pre-installed and insufficent Ruby that must be kept, but also overridden with a newer version. This is an all too common problem with Macs and built-in tools.
